snippet: In a report to Group of 20 leaders, regulators and central bankers found that the United States, the European Union and Japan are behind schedule on measures that were adopted as part of an effort to avert future banking crises.
abstract: In a report to Group of 20 leaders, regulators and central bankers found that the United States, the European Union and Japan are behind schedule on measures that were adopted as part of an effort to avert future banking crises.

headline.main: Panel Finds U.S. and Europe Behind Schedule on Financial Rules
